title: Bridging AI Safety and Agile Development From Code to Clarity
description: The relentless pace of Agile development, with its sprints and continuous deployment, has long been the engine of digital innovation. Yet, as this engine is increasingly fueled by complex artificial intelligence, a critical question emerges: how can we move fast without breaking things we can no longer see? The integration of AI, particularly opaque “black […]

title: New AI uncovers hidden patterns in biomedical knowledge graphs
description: A new artificial intelligence (AI) method called BioPathNet helps researchers systematically search large biological data networks for hidden connections—from gene functions and disease mechanisms to potential therapeutic approaches. BioPathNet was developed by teams at Helmholtz Munich and Mila—Quebec Artificial Intelligence Institute in Montreal, Canada. The researchers have now published the method in the journal Nature Biomedical Engineering.
content: A new artificial intelligence (AI) method called BioPathNet helps researchers systematically search large biological data networks for hidden connections—from gene functions and disease mechanisms to potential therapeutic approaches. BioPathNet was d... [3893 chars]

title: Davos 2026: China has caught up a lot with US, but yet to innovate beyond frontier, says Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
description: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, predicts artificial general intelligence will transform science and health within a decade, ushering in an era of abundance. He notes China's progress in AI capabilities but highlights its current lack of frontier innovations. Hassabis also discusses AI's impact on jobs and energy, emphasizing potential benefits and new opportunities.
content:

title: Using AI to understand the age of disease onset in Huntington's patients
description: A team from the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences and the Institute of Neurosciences at the University of Barcelona (UBneuro) has applied advanced artificial intelligence techniques to better understand why Huntington's disease can begin at very different ages in patients.

title: Tech Execs at Davos Highlight AI’s Power as a Geopolitical Tool
description: Anthropic’s Chief Executive Officer Dario Amodei compared artificial intelligence chips to nuclear weapons. Google DeepMind’s CEO said China’s technology is just months behind the US. Signal’s Meredith Whittaker called new adaptations of AI uniquely “perilous.”

title: Mubadala targets opportunities in AI and robotics, CEO says
description: Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund Mubadala is targeting opportunities in artificial intelligence and robotics, viewing the sectors as a major source of industrial growth and a guide for future investments, its group CEO said on Tuesday.

title: 'Here’s the bitter truth': Anupam Mittal’s AI warning divides internet, says 'AI is coming for...' - Trending News
description: Anupam Mittal’s blunt LinkedIn post warning that artificial intelligence could wipe out layers of middle management has sparked a sharp debate online, with professionals weighing whether AI will replace managers or simply force them to evolve.

title: Selling AI chips to China is like 'selling nuclear weapons to North Korea': Anthropic CEO
description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warned Tuesday that US firms like Nvidia should not sell their advanced artificial intelligence chips to China – calling the move a major mistake with “incredible national security implications.”

title: Palantir's Alex Karp warns World Economic Forum against large-scale immigration
description: Palantir CEO Alex Karp suggested that usage of artificial intelligence can improve civil liberties, while also warning Europe about its trajectory in contrast with the U.S. and China.
content:
Palantir CEO Alex Karp suggested Tuesday that usage of artificial intelligence "bolsters civil liberties," while also warning Europe that its adoption of technology is falling behind the U.S. and China.

title: Palantir CEO says AI to make large-scale immigration obsolete
description: Artificial intelligence will displace so many jobs that it will eliminate the need for mass immigration, according to Palantir Technologies Inc. Chief Executive Officer Alex Karp.
content:
